Interface Destructible

All Known Implementing Classes:
Actor, ActorLevelUp, Boss, BossProjectile, BossTwo, BossTwoProjectile, EnemyPlaneOne, EnemyPlaneTwo, EnemyProjectile, HeartItem, Projectile, Shield, UserPlane, UserProjectile
public interface Destructible
Interface representing objects that can be destroyed and take damage. This interface is designed for objects that need to respond to damage and destruction logic, typically used in games or simulations.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    destroy()
    Destroys the object, marking it as no longer active or functional.
    void
    takeDamage(int damage)
    Applies damage to the object, reducing its health or durability.

  • Method Details

    • takeDamage

      void takeDamage(int damage)
      Applies damage to the object, reducing its health or durability. Implementations should define how the damage affects the object's state.
      Parameters:
      damage - the amount of damage to apply; must be a non-negative integer.

    • destroy

      void destroy()
      Destroys the object, marking it as no longer active or functional. Implementations should define what happens when the object is destroyed, such as removing it from the game world or triggering an explosion effect.
